metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39636 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In do_ipt_get_ctl and do_ipt_set_ctl of ip_tables.c, there is a possibleway to leak kernel information due to uninitialized data. This could leadto local information disclosure with system execution privileges needed.User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-120612905References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
